Hold your breath!!!. Large swathes of green scenery pleasing to the eyes.. just wonderful. We had lunch at a restaurant on the way to ulan danu with the view of the tegalang rice terrace.. it was awesome

Amazing Rice Terrace. Bali has many working rice paddies and most of them are in the center of the island. We were staying in Seminyak so naturally Ubud is the closest one to visit. The Tegalalang paddies is about 15-20 mins north of the city center of Ubud and approximately one and a half hour drive from Seminyak. You can easier hire a driver to take you there within USD 40. The Tegalalang Rice Terrace is stunning, and it is my first experience of seeing a rice paddies at a close up.There are shops that sell ceramics, paintings, clothing, wood craved furniture and accessories along this route to Ubud, we have negotiated with the driver and he took us to a few of them to get our souvenirs.

Photographers' Dream. We arrived in the morning and I took some great panoramic photos of the beautiful rice terraces. After visiting some other sites in the countryside, we returned in the afternoon to take more photos with the sun behind us lighting up the terraces. Although very touristy, The view is that of a truly world class wonder! I got my best photos of anywhere I visited in Bali. I have a 24 by 60 inch photo in my office of the terraces, next to my Ansel Adams photo of Yosemite. I recommend it most highly.

Some of the most beautiful rice terraces in all of Bali.. These rice terraces are truly gorgeous. It's a rather crowded spot where you have to park with lots of people selling stuff but the terraces are worth the effort.

Lots of tourist and a beautifull scenery. The first time I visited was in 1985. It was beautifull and authentic. During later visits in 1994, 2006, 2009, 2012 and 2015 more and more tourists. Still nice but a lot of tourists
Beautiful view. A lovely place to sit and have lunch, overlooking the rice terraces. Restaurant food was varied and delicious.

Very exotic valley. Visit it at the end of the afternoon, that's when the colors are the best. It's very beautiful to see this valley of rice terraces. However, there are to many tourists to really enjoy the moment and take great "people virgin" pictures.

Amazing view, ruined by greedy locals. The rice terraces at Tegalalang and simply amazing and beautiful! Really worth the trip. Entrance ticket is inexpensive, however at several places on the way, there are locals that stop you and do not let you pass, unless you give them some "donation"! When we tried to give 5000 rupiah per person, the local would get angry and ask us for more. On the 3rd guy asking for "donation", we just turned back.

Beautiful!!!. It was so green and beautiful...we really love it. There's a small coffee shop overlooking the paddy field where we had a fried banana drizzled with honey...enjoying the view while having a good snack food..blissed!!!

scenic and beautiful. the quintessential picture of Bali - there are small rice fields everywhere in Bali next to roads, houses, in between villas and hotels so this one is just a much larger much cooler version of it all. doesnt take long to walk through the whole place but if you dont want to go down, you can just get dropped off on the street and take a picture from an elevated level with the rice fields in the background. (we hired a driver for the day http://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attraction_Review-g297694-d3213576-Reviews-Bali_Driver_Gede_Day_Tours-Denpasar_Bali.html and this was one of our stops - we were only here for 20 mins to take pictures as we had a lot of other stops to make as well - this is 5 mins from bali pulina agro tourism - coffee plantation - so you can plan these two trips together http://www.tripadvisor.com.au/Attraction_Review-g297695-d3435076-Reviews-Bali_Pulina_Agro_Tourism-Gianyar_Bali.html

Wonderful View. Visiting the rice terraces is s must in Bali. It is a special attraction. Great view from the batik shop overlooking the rice terraces. You can take nice pictures and enjoy the view and have a nice refreshing drink, you can buy a Balinese design shawl or painting as well.

Visiting Tegalalang Rices Terraces. This is a great place to walk around (max 1-hour) and you really get to appreciate the famous Bali Rice Terraces. It is busy but if you walk/climb to the far side you find some peace and quiet. However have some small change as there are stops where you are asked to donate to the bridge you have just crossed or whatever is the donation emphasis for that day. As there is no entrance fee - the donations are justified.

Amazing Experience. We found them to be out of this world the lush greenery and the vast size of the valley is just unexplainable. don't waste much time visiting other terraces, Tegalalang takes the whole experience to another level. there are several vendors around selling may local items mostly art, but also several souvenirs.Enjoy =)
Beautiful . Very impressive landmark in Ubud. A must see. The visit won't take long no expensive tickets needed. Simply beautiful
Great view and atmosphere. Tegalalang paddy rice field has such a great view, and nice atmosphere. The weather is a bit cold, though it's quite far from the city but it's worth a visit.

It could have been better.. I was a little disappointed. Pretty view but to actually walk around would have required more stamina than I had at the end of a long day. We had some expensive tea at the restaurant at the top so we did enjoy the view. There was a little bit of a sewer smell, not totally unusual in developing countries. We had hired a driver so he assisted in getting us in without being bothered by touts. It is also the dry season so things didn't look as lush as it might.

Nice view over rice fields. We arrived in the village, the car parked and the driver motioned us to walk up the street to find the rice fields. The sign posting was bad, I seemed to find one set of steps down, but they were far too steep for our party. I walked further along the road and suddenly there was a terrace with okay views over the rice fields.

Amazing. Really enjoyed trekking up and down the rice fields. Beautiful scenary and got some fab pics.There is a small donation to pay at the bottom near the bridge and another higher on the far side. Apart from that we only had 1 person offer staged photos and 1 child pushing postcards, so very mamagable compaired to what some reviews on here say (which almost put me off going!)
return visit. this is our second visit ,and I enjoyed it as much this time as I did the first, its very interesting to see all the work that has been done here over the generations, we worth a visit

Beautiful drive, view and relaxing lunch. Yes it's surrounded by shops and restaurants but pick a restaurant overlooking the terraces and enjoy the view and tranquility. We picked a restaurant at random and had a sensational meal. We didn't walk the terraces admittedly but we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. And yes there are other terraces in Bali but not with quite the same view.

Donation!. What a rip off. The Scenery is amazing, but do not get roped into the donation scam the two terrible women and elderly old man are trying to sell. Pick an amount, put it in the basket and walk through. Its a donation, you choose the amount. Just walk past the screams.

Not as amazing as i expected. I thought i would see sweeping rice terraces but no, the area is too small.. I've seen better ones in Philippines. Also be mindful to those locals, they ask you to take a photo of them and demand you pay them after. If you want to go up to get better views you need to pay those guys on hut 10,000 idr. But we read on TA that if you go up more and pay the 2nd hut another 10,000 idr you'll get a better view even more. Lucky we did pay, we like it more on the other side. Plants were much better and not much people.

Don't bother to see these, but go explore!. There are much more beautiful rice terraces in the surrounding of Petulu. We especially drove here to see this, but we had seen more gorgeous rice-fields in many other places..

Beautiful and interesting!. We stopped off here on our Bali Hai Bike Tour before getting to the actual biking. These are rice terraces that for tourists to look at and walk around. You can spend a lot of time here hiking up and down the terraces. We only spent about half an hour here, including stopping for a beer at a little restaurant that overlooks the rice terraces. The views from all over were incredible. It's a bit tricky to make your way on the little dirt paths, so I wouldn't wear white shoes. There is a lady waiting for tourists near the top of the hill, who will hand you a rice hat and the baskets used for carrying so that you can take a picture. We enjoyed posing for a picture, but she will charge you 10000 IDR per person.

Beautiful Views over Rice Field Panorama. This is a really beautiful place to visit.The views stretching out all around is so extensive and hard to find places like this.If you are lucky you will see the rice being harvested and all the processes involved by a group of local farmers.Highly recommended visit.Nice restaurants there to stop at and enjoy the views.
Good. It was a good place, but not unmissable.We stopped there on our way to Tanah Lot Temple.If you have time (the terrace is like 2hs driving from Ubud) visit!
Rice fields. Stunning view, very well made, offers the best photo op, Do climb up and then enjoy the view from the resturants

Stunning; best rice terraces in Bali. Dramatic, sweeping views of green. Lush rice paddies on steep hills. In my opinion, better than Jatiluwih. It's smaller and more compact, but it really left an impression. You could spend an hour or several walking around. Although it's a relatively small area, the climbs are very steep and can take a while. Plan to spend some time here because you won't be able to run back to the car quickly.Tips:--As with all things in Bali, come prepared with bug spray, sun spray, and plenty of water. --You access this place from a tiny little path in between shops on the road - ask for directions from your driver.--Arrive at 11am or earlier. There were no crowds and it wasn't hot yet. --We paid for tickets at a parking lot nearby, but then no one checked for our tickets. Then about 15 minutes into the hike, we passed a "donation point" where we gave 5000 rupiah to a random man at a little stand. It was definitely odd, but completely expected that these types of things happen while traveling through Bali. It's not a big deal. Come prepared with smaller bills on hand.
nice place to visit. very nice rice fields in terraces. A tourist place, of course, but very useful for knowing how Balinese people grow up rice.
Must see!. It's just 20min ride from ubud town and I fall in love with this place when I reached there. Your will see the true Bali. A must to visit when you are in ubud

A highway for tourist !!. If you see just this one coming in Bali for the forst time in Bali , you could be impressed by this Terasse , but franckly speaking there are many other beautiful rice terasse in the island and much less crowded .Big desapointment , the terasse is surrounded by a sea of restaurants for tourists one next to the other .A place to avoid if you love nature and calm

Find your spot, reach the jungle. There is a touristic path when you can have a quick view on the field, but you really have to get off and find you own way. These rice fields are very authentic 300m off the touristic place and way more beautiful. We met a farmer and shared a great moment around a Nangka (fruit) that he just picked up from a tree he climbed.

Amazing views!. This rice terrrace is by far the most best rice terrace ive seen, the lauers are beautifull its fully green and the vieuw is amazing. There are nice shops and good restaurants that have a good vieuw too, so book your driver and let him take you to the tegalalang rice terrace because u cant miss this one!! (Watch out for slipping cuz my bf got stuck in one of the terraces)
Stunning. Just wandering through this beautiful landscape that goes back many centuries is a real treat and a true taste of the real Bali.

Amazing views. Beautiful place to visit, lots of shops and restaurants surrounding, you can walk all around the paddies, and you can have photos with the farmers there, for us we was only there an hour or so but its definitely a highlight to our stay on this island.

Bit of a rip off. You have to pay to glance across the road at the rice terraces. To get your money's worth, park the car and walk over to the edge. Lots of markets and food stalls in this area so be prepared to spend more money!

Mesmerising. We arrived at a cafe overlooking the rice terrace and first enjoyed a meal and took in the wonderful view. Then we walked down the very many steps to the bottom of the terraces where there is a stream running through. You can get refreshments along the stairway and you might need them and a rest on the way back up! You must take the walk down to the rice fields to really appreciate them as you can't really see how they are from up above. It was dry season when we went and thongs were okay but the paths are narrow and if you get into the mud you can easily slip. Sensible shoes in the wet season would be a must.The climb back up the stairs would only be recommended for fit people as there are many stairs and it is a steep climb.

One of the Iconic Sights of Bali. Rode out here in the early morning and avoided all of the crowds and heat that many other reviewers complained about. The terraces are in a fairly small area and it's easy to get out and explore them throughly in around an hour. While it was nice to walk among them, I found the best views were from the roadside lookouts as the other side of the valley has you looking back to the shops and restaurants on the hillside. Would probably visit again.
Close, interesting and touristy. It's a quick trip from Ubud. So its convenient. But therefore crowded and quite touristy. Wonderful to see the terracing structure.

Interesting but very busy. Go only if this is your only chance to view a rice terrace as there are better ones on other day tours. There are many little bridges expecting small donations along the way so make sure you have small denomination bills with you.
Beautiful nature. It is a great place. I recommend it for visiting. But only people in good shape will be able to walk there. It is same as climbing a huge stairs. Bring a bottle of water

Nice to walk around but busy. We visited the rice terraces here while on a day trip of Ubud. The place is very busy with lots of shops along the road and hardly any space to park. As with most of Bali you have to pay/tip for various things. Our driver dropped us off but needed money to pay for a space some way down the road where we would meet him later.Although it is free to wander onto the rice terraces, there are a number of sellers who will try to get you to buy something as you are wanting to get onto the trail. I found the sellers near the entrances (of which there are many routes) to be more persistent than at other places we visited in Bali. However, maybe that was us being unlucky.There were also a lot of young children trying to sell us postcards and other small items as we began our decent onto the rice terraces.Now while it is free to access the terraces themselves, there are a number of "stations" which have been set up on the trail where you will be asked for a "donation". The first of these I found amusing as it was labelled "the bridge donation fund". Funny because the bridge was obviously not really maintained. A small donation of 10,000 or so is fine.The next checkpoint we hit merely said donation and as we tried to pass it we were physically stopped by an old man who would not let us pass without putting money into the pot...not really a donation then is it?! Again something small like 10,000 should be fine.Overall, the views are lovely on a good day, though the physical exercise is probably more than you think...we were sweating. Also, it can be quite slippery and there are no safety features like hand rails on most of the route, even though it can be very steep and uneven. I would not recommend it to anyone who does not feel confident on their feet or has little balance. There aren't really many "passing points" so you have to try and squeeze past other people coming from the opposite direction without pushing either off the edge.Definitely worth a visit, but remember to have small change/notes for the "donations" and that however long you take going out into the terraces, you will need to trek that amount of time back when you turn around...it's pretty big!

Amazing views of spectacular terraces of rice fields. We drove past these terraces and you just have to stop and admire the view. Really worth seeing! There are also walks which you can do through the terraces, unfortunately we didnt have the time to do!

well worth a visit. fantastic view which varies depending on how long the rice has been planted - when we went we saw a lot of water as they had just started growing but as they get 3 cycles in a year it is a bit pot luck - last time we came it was a luscious green everywhere as it was nearly ready to collect. The terraces are impressive as machinery can not be used so they do things the old fashioned and traditional way (although I bet they have a few technological aids these days). But back to the facts - it is one of the views in Bali that you should see along with the odd temple and beach etc

Nice view !!. Nice view...didn't have the time to walk down plus the hot weather, will definitely plan an early morning trip here in my next trip. Do sit by the Rice Terrace Cafe and enjoy the great view

Very touristy. The rice terrace was packed with tourists and vendors. When I took a photo one of the vendors wanted to be paid as I had taken the photo in his general direction so I refused to pay and wiped the photo. Ok for a brief visit.
Post card view. This is one of the famous post card views on Bali, the terraces are quit amazing. And they are all hand built no machines was used. If you go to Bali you have to see them.

Nice introduction to rice terraces. If you don't have time to visit any of the major rice terraces in Bali, this one gives you a pretty good idea. I stopped here while on my way to Mount Batur, and I'm glad I did. You don't have to hire a guide or make donation, just take a walk around the terraces, take pictures and enjoy.

Beautiful rice fields. This is a must visit spot with beautiful view. The unique scenery was created by ancient Baliese farmers. The irrigation system was used in many rice field throughout Asia. I guess the easy access is the key point for this spot~
Awesome. Beautiful sight, hasn't been exercising so climbing up & down was miserable. Love the scenery, one must visit when in Bali.
Beautiful views. The rice fields are beautiful. There is a toll to enter the area and a few shops but the main reason to stop is for a photo opportunity.

Beautiful. . Beautiful place to visit. Still in operation, the locals were a little hungry for an involuntary donation .. Of which two different families demanded 5000 idr. Not the end of the world. Really beautiful when you walk through, and get of the main touristy bits! Well worth a visit

Beautiful terraces . Went for a quick visit, small fee to enter but then you get hit up for donations on the way. Quite touiristy, would recommend shoes and it can be quite slippery in some places but we did ok in jandals. Nice photo opportunity. Heaps of cafes and market stalls on the side, would be a nice spot to stop for lunch. Enjoyed visiting here :)

Beautiful. Beautiful! We got a driver all around Ubud and this is one place he took us. Beware of the locals who stand at spots along the way and tell you you have to pay, you don't and they're just taking the money for themselves. Walking out we walked through sewage so just be careful and wear good walking shoes. Otherwise was absolutely amazing!

Terrible and super crowded. Huge amount of tourists. Terraces are far from being the most beautiful on Bali. Forget about taking beautiful picture here and enjoying terraces - huge crowds of tourists will not allow you to do it.
Beautiful . Gorgoeus views. Worth the trip up the mountain for it. Have a tour guide with you that knows the area, just to avail of the extra information.

Really beautiful. The tegalalang rice terrace is really one of many rice terraces in Bali, it's beautiful to see, it's only a pity that they use it as a tourist attraction with a lot of shops and restaurants ..
Rice Terrace. One can see soothing views of terraced paddy fields. Also along the road-side are many steeped cafes, which are indeed a relaxing place (with a sip of tea/ coffee).

hmmm ... it's a showcase rice terrace .... well ... where should i start. It's a beautiful rice terrace, but built for tourist. I wouldn't say ... a lot of walking, but definitely a lot of climbing and steep steps.watch out for bridge tolls! they wouldn't let us go unless we pay 20k rupiah!by the way, watch up for an old lady in bra and skirt. She clings on to man.i would say ... if you want to have a relax walk at the paddy field - take the FREE walk at the rice paddy field near Cafe Lotus in Ubud.

Amazing....This is what travelling is all about! . WOW, if I could just leave them three letters then I would! This place is beautiful and amazing. It makes the 22hours on a plane all worth it. Come early like o did around 8AM, no crowds and better pictures!

Expected more. Maybe I had too high expectations of the place. It was quite a long drive there and it wasn't too big. I kinda expected hills and hills of rice terraces but it was just one area. Good view though and you can walk down the valley and onto the other side.

MUST SEE!. Stunning views of terraced padi fields, so quinessentially hinterland Bali it is a MUST SEE! What's even more cool are the little cafes steeped along the side of the hill that is overlooking the rice terraces. We picked on place to sit down, have some traditional balinese snacks and dessert, while taking in the views. Would certainly recommend that.

Stunning view. Amazing nature view of the tegalalang rice terrace. You can walk and trek around the area. We choose to have a nice lunch in the restaurant there first and then explore the area nearby.

Lots of walking!. Amazing views from the top! Would advise to do at the start of the day as there will be lots of waking if you want to see all of it! Stock up on water too although there was one place at the top that sold drinks. Oh and make sure you wear comfortable footwear :-)

Take small change. Take good shoes as you walk right down the tracks in the hill then up the other side. Then back down and then up to get out. Allow 30 mins. Amazing to look at and we have some great photos but take small change as many donations are required along the way. As Sophie G's review some are offended if you don't give enough. No one tells you what it's for, who they are or how much is reasonable. Luckily we had enough to get up over to the other side and back out. We encounter 4 toll donations. 5000 seemed to be normal each time and certainly lots of those notes in the boxes. Oh yes, that's around £0.23p. :-) not much but it would be nice to know in advance. Especially as we were usually carrying much larger denomination notes. Else you'd have more wads of cash than Harry Enfield's loadsamoney character. Certainly something to do in Bali and if you like shopping then driving through Ubud is an eye opener too.

Too touristy to be a decent rice field but great education for your children . I guess it depends on the season when you visit. It was a hot sunny day for me, kinda like a dry season. The fields is exactly what you see in those pictures, nothing else left for imagination, as I was expecting a more grandeur rice field. Nevertheless, it was still good scenery and education for kids. Unless you are visiting other rice fields, this place is still worth a visit.
Pleasant and relaxing :). A meaningful morning activity. Very tranquil. I enjoyed the strolling and fresh air. Just take extra care when traversing the terraces, especially those narrow mud paths!

Amazing photo's. Beautiful area with the most amazing ricefields in Ubud. It's located about 30-40 minutes on scooter outside of Ubud. You should combine this trip with going to the Tirta Empul temple where you can do a cleansing water ritual. Also with the rice terraces comes some old temples and old buildings.
Rice Terrace. We had our driver take us here. Very beautiful but ruined by people wanting donations every so often. I'd rather pay an entrance fee and not be hit up for anything else.

What a great experience. We decide for our 1 day in Ubud to go around on motorbike, that is the best way to see and discover the real Ubud, so we arrive in Tegalalang and we see this wounderful place full of colour and peace when we decide just to sit down and looking around in the very early morning the best moment to go there!You can also stay on the top where a little souvenir shop have drinks for a reasonable price and there some chairs where you can sit and enjoy the simple spectacle of nature.Don't miss it

Beautiful scene. This is very touristy but still so picturesque that is worth the visit. The green is just so vibrant and a cafe nearby with these gorgeous views is just lovely. Very busy with buses and cars etc on the road.

The stunning rice terrace of Tegallalang. In Tegallalang village which is close to Ubud, you can find the rice terrace. As you step off the undulating road into the terrace, you will be welcomed by the stunning panoramic view of the rice terrace. Lush green steps of rice paddy field envelops you. We climbed down the cliff to the bottom of the field and then climbed up the opposite side to the top again to get the view from the other side of the rim. It was quite tiresome but felt good and got some nice snaps. Tip: If you are planning on climbing down the terrace field, carry a pair of sneakers. I was wearing a flip flop with smooth bottom which was slippery.
Nice views. Very good place where is possible show to children how rice produce from A to Z. Some restaurants with view to rice fields,reccommended!
You xan tell once you are up here . Amazing place must to visit you can see the real bali up there. Difficult with parking you might pay the parking guy 10K for the Parking .

Watch your footwear. We went here at the last minute and i didn't even think about footwear. Tiny strap thongs are not suitable for this if you want to properly explore. I was limited on the way down because of it. Terraces looked beautiful and green. Bought some clothes from stalls along the strip,cheaper than seminyak and less aggressive in their selling techniques.
Waooooo. this review very short for sure this is just amazing, awesome, there is no word that could express the feeling when you see those rice fields, it is special

Gorgeous rice terraces. Stunning view over the rice terraces in the village of Tegalalang. Very nice and refreshing. I wouldn't go all the way there just to see the terraces but it is definitely worth it if you are in the area.
Beautiful scenery. lovely scenery. Didn't have enough time to explore it all. Take flat shoes as can be muddy and scrambling around on steep paths.
Rice paddy of bali superb must visit. I visited rice paddy in bali they are awesome foreigners strolling around taking videos and snaps ..I also took some.. Nice experience

Know what to expect. What to expect there:- lots of other tourists- entrance fee of IDR 10,000 per person (sept 2015); three 'donation' points to take the full tour, we paid IDR 5,000 for three persons at each spot- amazing landscape, especially after the second donation point (round the corner, can't be seen from the street)A lot of people here complain about being scammed or ripped off, but I mean, you spend hundreds of dollars to get there and then complain about one additional dollar.. Come on...

It's so small than we expected . We don't spend time in this place much.I think It's beautiful but It's so small.You can walk down to the rice terraces and enjoy the view with good drink. They're have many cafe around the rice terrace.If you don't have time in Bali I recommended you to skip this place because they have more attraction place around Ubud.
RICE TERRACE!!. Nice place to see the rice terrace but it is not as big as I've seen from the postcard. Sit back and relax at the restaurants with rice terrace view from afar is a good choice.
Crowded and overrated. Skip this , there are plenty of other Rice Terraces around with no Tourists about just drive up the Road a bit more .

dificult parking and geting to komercial. One of Gianyar districk icon is here. but than all service and hospitality culiner is not reasonable price any more. the view is Awesome .but not real natural as use to by. now is setting like a big huge garden
Great photo locationfor rice terraces. Excellent scenic stop on a trip to take those iconic rice paddy pictures. An awesome location which ought to be able to inspire any landscape photographer!
Underwhelming . Doesn't live up to its rave ratings, not sure what the hype is about. Isn't a v big area too. If it was a real place for sustenance, it wouldn't quite cut it as a tourist attraction

Beautiful nature. It was just amazing, we had a really good view above the rice fields. It was nice to see haw it works. I would like to hardly recommend you a tour across Bali and don't forger the rice fields.
Green Field. Best time to go is early October. Have some times can walk along the fields and learn the process personally.

Refreshing. One of the must visit when you head to Bali. It might be unbearable under the hot sun but the scenic view is just breathtaking. You can just drop by to take a photo or you can have a walk around the paddy fields.
Green !. The food on numara! Soooo tasty and make us not wanna stop to eat ! and your eyes will be very fresh see view there.

nive views. you can go with motorcicle and see a nive views.
arround 20 min walking.
and take something there. no much. the back to ubud was horrible for the mosquito in my face ;)

Lovely photos, watch your step!. Beautiful scenery and great spot for photos. A few steep climbs, but worth a visit. Try to go to the back of the rice fields (over the top at the back) and see the real rice fields in the area behind the tourist spot. It looks deserted but a few extra steps is worth the view to see everyone picking the rice.

Must see, breathe taking. Never have ever seeing rice terraces, this is a must see. I stopped by this place on my bike tour and only regret not staring at it for longer. People say you can easily hike this and is about 20 min drive from Ubud center.

Beautiful view!!. Very beautiful rice terrace near Ubud. It was part of Bali private day tour and we stopped here for 15 mins and really liked it. The place has become a bit commercialized now but still have nice view.
Nice lunch with a view. The place is a bit crowded. The food was good. The view is good with the rice paddy. The locals were friendly.

Scenic Walk. The journey here can be very labourious and discouraging, however, when you arrive you will be well rewarded. Take your time and explore the entire rice terrace. It is a compromise if you cannot make time to visit Jatiluwih

Honest review for fellow confused travellers.. Lovely views but several 'donation' spots (though it isn't really a donation as your have to pay money to pass, and we had our small money turned down for more which I thought was very rude!). These definitely spoil the atmosphere.Worth a visit but nothing to extraordinary. I was very disappointed.

Beautiful!. I have never seen a rice paddy before so this was amazing and beautiful! the work that goes into it and the people just do it, they have my total respect. So if you have never seen one please do and of course take the children. This is a learning experience for all! I did not climb down. There are restaurants around this area so you can get food and have access to their restrooms. this is not a pay at the gate attraction but we had to pay a little something to get out our car.

Still offering lovely views - just a bit more commercial than before.. We have been visiting Tegalalang Rice Terraces for many years and could not believe how popular this place has now become. The views are still beautiful but the viewpoint is now filled with restaurants and market stalls. We were able to walk into the rice terraces following a well trod path and although it was fairly crowded, it was a lovely place to enjoy rice terrace views. A few of the locals have realised the value of tourist visitors and will happily pose for photos - for a fee of course! Also be prepared to donate to the locals for the maintenance of the track, bridges etc. It is up to you how much you contribute and some will not let you pass until you donate.
Just fine.. Small roads with heavy traffic going here, vendors are on the sides, cannot have good view on terraces on the road or view deck.

Small but beautiful. Tegalalang Rice Terrace is within a half an hour drive from Ubud. If you've visited Jatiluwih or other rice fields in Tabanan, these are small in comparison, but they look impressive as the hills on which they are situated are fairly steep. The terrace can be viewed perfectly from one of the many cafés/restaurants by the road - Teras Padi Cafe is among the largest and has a good menu for both refreshing drinks and lunch.
beautiful but there are better ones in Bali. Very touristic rice terraces. On the previous week we drove to Amed area and saw many more beautiful ones at both sides of the narrow road

Not so interesting . We went there just to take a few photos and go, honestly we pay an entrance fee of RP 10,000 and just to see the rice Terrace is only about 5 min, because there is nothing else to do there. ...

Walikng the rice fields. Simply amazing. If you love a walk this is a very pleasant experience to see how this is all done. I love the ducks they use In the fields. You have to visit and see why ducks are so important to rice fields

Beautiful. Stunning and truly amazing. It is one of the sights that must be seen on any trip to Bali. Do not even hesitate, make it a part of a tour (for example along with the Royal Palace, Pura Ulun on Beratan Lake and a few other temples)

Must-see rice terrace sight close to Ubud. I did not take a tour to get here. Instead, we hired a taxi directly here at 8AM to avoid all the traffic. You'll need around 1 hour to walk through the whole terrace and take photos. I'd recommend an earlier start so you don't run into the larger crowds along the narrow ridges of the terrace.There's a few small tolls along the way, but they're not bad and for a good cause. I think a few bucks is worth the incredible views. Definitely break out the panorama mode for this one.

Impressive. Absolutely worth a visit while staying in Bali. We went there by scooter from Ubud, it's not far away and easy to find. The view is amazing and you can walk on the rice terraces but you have to give a donation for the farmers otherwise they won't let you pass. It's a pitty that they ask money for the entrance, parking and for a donation (even if it's still cheap)

Stunning views, relaxing sounds. We didn't walk on the terraces but sat at Srilaba Warung sipping ginger tea and gazed upon them. Stopped here by chance while returning to Ubud from Mt Batur and the hot springs.

Lush green beauty. We visited the rice paddy fields in the afternoon in August. Contrary to what oothers have written in TA, we did not find it too busy and filled with people. The view from the road is beautiful : step irrigation with ample greenery. The coconut and palm trees lining the fields added to the beauty. There was no entry fees. Enough restaurants and shops on the road with an open view of the fields

Beautiful paddy rice terrace view!. I love Tegalalang. Your trip in Bali won't be completed without seeing the real Bali paddy terrace. Reminds me the scene of Julia Robers in Eat, Pray and Love. Just seeing the paddy terrace makes me feel so relaxing, calm and peace. And some terrace has 'bebek' which is the paddy duck. Go for it!
Beautiful place. Definitaly worth to stop by and enjoy stunning view. It is also possible to go around these fields. You can easily reach this place by motorbike.

Beautiful views. Drove here on last trip just to look once again on the way back to Ubud. Not far from ubud and if you feel adventureous you can also go to another temple close by and walk down to the Kings and Queens temple which is divided by a small creek. The King is one side and the Queen is on the other. These are built into a sandstone wall and monks take care of the both. I was told that these are somewhere around 1000 years old, go and have a look. I have to tell you that it is a long walk down and many steps back up but the steps are quite wide not like the ones you walk down and back up doing the water rafting.

Just photograph it from the street. We found this these terraces to be really busy with little space for people to pass by. I also found it really frustrating that after paying entry we were also charged at every bridge we crossed. We ended up getting fed up and left. The best views of the terraces are from street level.
Great Photo Spot. Amazing views of the rice paddy fields and the lines that flow down the hill. You do now have to pay to park there if you stop for a photo... but it is worth it.

Would be attractive without all the tourists. Unfortunately we didn't consult Trip Advisor before visiting Tegalalang, and wished we had. The Terrace is pretty enough, but is so overrun with tourists (at least, when we visited in high season) and traders targeting them that it was impossible for us to appreciate on its merits. We had a coffee overlooking the Terrace for ten minutes, and got back in the car. However, if you can stand the crowds, are passing through and don't have time to see rice terraces elsewhere in Bali, it's probably worth a quick stop-off.

Massive!. You don't see anything like this in England- there are vast terraces in nicely designed layers which you an walk up and down and along. It's free to walk around and incredible sight. Worth a visit!Just outside Ubud- we did this on the way back from a day trip visiting attractions all around the island.

Beautiful views!. We went here with our driver from Kampung Cafe. Went first to Gunung Kawi Tampaksiring where we walked a lot. At Tegalalang we paid a small entrance fee of 10.000 inr. per person and had a drink in a restaurant overlooking the gorgeous ricefields. You could make a walk there too, but as we are still tired from the morning walk, we were just sitting here and enjoying the views. Can recommend!

Morning beauty. Beautiful place to visit on a motor scooter. Riding throught the villages is a must. I went on a misty morning after first visiting the early morning market. Taking the long way around, I was able to visit several small villages / towns as they prepared for an up coming festival, while taking in the lovely scenery of the gardens. There are tours, but if you can handle a scooter, just go. It is breathtaking.

Too many tourists. These rice terraces are super beautiful but most certainly over run with a lot of tourists. The best time to visit is early morning as there is no one about and the suns rays illuminate the rice paddies beautifully. There are many shops here and also many restaurants selling everything you could ever want. It's a beautiful part of the world and deserves a visit just not in the middle of the day.
enjoying my view. nice view.very calm . good food. very nature n u can go down to explore the rice terrace. very relaxing
Must-visit rice terraces. We had lunch in a cafe in Ceking overlooking the rice terraces then wandered through the terraces afterwards. Utterly stunning, our 5 year old loved it too.

A small perfect miniature of how a rice terrace is supposed to be. One might argue that Tegalalang rice terraces are too turisty but, you know what, I am a tourist at the end of the day and I enjoyed walking through these small but perfectly maintained terraces that allowed me to have a complete idea of the place, take beautiful pictures, climb up and down as I liked and all of this in the lapse of 1 hour. I have also seen jatiluih and sideman valley, still I do not regret having seen tegalalang and definitely recommend a stop here!

Peaceful and beauiftul. This was a fantastic visit and is well-worth doing. Took an ojek (great for using if you are a lone-traveller) for Rp100,000 for a return from Ubud City-centre and also got him to stop at other places along the way. So peaceful and tranquil, it really was beautiful. Tons of tourists though so if you fancy a quieter visit, try down-season or first thing in the morning

Beautiful but avoid if you don't like places overrun with tourists. My god, look at all those tourists -- probably not what you came here to see. The rice fields up Jalan Kejang in Ubud are larger and much more peaceful, but if you're heading past Tegalalang, sure, check it out.

Not bad. Nice view with just 30 min drive from Ubud town centre. Plus the coffee farms nearby where you can taste the luwak coffee. Considering it takes more than 2 hours to drive to the UNESCO protected rice fields Jatiluwih, Tegalalang is certainly worth going, The only drawback is perhaps it's a bit crowded and touristic.
Really pretty. Nice to see but shop vendors everywhere chasing you for a sale. Very pretty though. You can walk down and take photos. Best if you hire a driver for the day to take you around.
Rice terrace treat. Now this is a stunning place for a traditional Balinese meal. Great food, staff and what a tranquil view to look out over. Thanks to our driver for taking us here. Loved it
Rice fields. Beautiful to see the green rice fields with local Balinese people working in them to plant rice and paddy.

Cool for a photo but find the other access points that give you a more realistic impression of Bali rice terraces. Find a guide to take you to the non touristy places of these rice terraces. There is a main strip that is cool for a photo but the real impressive parts are where there are locals tending to their fields.

one of the amazing tourist attraction in Bali. the view is very nice, you will very lucky if you visit this place while is harvest time because you will see the local how the do that, very interesting to see

Liked them.. . We visited in non season so there are no rice fields as such there but still it is good to see terrace farming.. The way they are designed and the way water flows through them step by step is good to see.. Not very far from ubud so you can visit them when you are around.. Also don't forget to buy all your souvenirs on that way.. They are rightly priced and way cheaper than anything you get in Ubud.. We got few items at below 10000 rp and the same are priced at 60 to 70000 in ubud market. With good bargain you can manage it for 20 to 30k at max.. So make sure you buy them there.. Variety is limited though..

Take a picture, continue on...... While on our way into Ubud, the driver pulled off long enough for us to cross the busy road, and grab a few pictures. Beautiful to see all the green rice terraces.Only stayed maybe 15 minutes, and then zipped away towards Ubud.

Amaizing view. On the way to Ubud you can find beautifull place - Tegalalank rise terraces. Good place to stay for 1-2 hours to walk truough the rice fields, to drink someting in the bar with amaizing view. Higly recommend to stay during your trip to Ubud.
Go if you like tourists. This place is so full of tourists that we did not even stop !I suggest you either choose another location or watch a video.

Rent a scooter and go there!. Don´t go with any company, just rent your own scooter for 50.000 IDR and drive there! Definitely worth the trip and it only is a 25 min ride from Ubud! On the way you will find some warehouses where they have a stock of wouden sculptures. If you want some cheap but beautiful souvenirs, this is the place!
Very nice. It is very nice! Needs to be done! At the entrance, not necessery to give too much (we just gave 2000rp). Do not hesitate to go deeper in the valley that is right adjacent.

Pleasant. These terraces are quite pleasant but watch out for double charging. We paid the entrance fee but later we were accosted by a rather menacing man who also wanted to be paid. The farmers who own the terraces get paid through the main ticket office where we originally paid, but this man wanted more. It was all very unpleasant. Better to save your entrance fee and have coffee in one of the many cafes overlooking the terraces where the views are just as good.
Wonderful scenery!. It is a really very interesting place to visit!The whole area and the scenes are amazing!The kindness and the smile of the local people and the farmers made our day!
Picture stop.. Nothing more. Worth a stop.. For a photo or two.. Coming from india.. We have plenty of such fields.. Maybe people from other countries likely to have a different view..

Beautiful, chilled out experience. Beautiful and definitely worth visiting. Glad I'd been working out before I went to Bali though - those stairs up and down to get to the rice fields. Woo! If you're unable to manage the stairs it's still quite nice to visit the fields and instead have a meal and drink at one of the many cafes on the hill that overlook the rice fields.

Bali is always wondeful, every place in Bali are always a vacation.. The view to was breathtaking, the food was superb, especially the nasi kuning, the weather was pleasant, everything was wonderful. That was the vacay should be.
Just fine. It is beautiful but not as good as the photos on google shows it. Local paddy fields are far more scenic than this. We explored and found a lot of such scenic places.

Very interesting. You can walk between the fields which is very interesting. Take proper shoes. Entry is free, but you will be stopped 2-3 times for donation. The view with fields and the little houses behind is really impressive. Do not hesitate to walk on sides of the fields where other people dont walk. Parking on main road was 10.000 IDR.

No 1 to visit in Ubud. Just wonderful! Entrance is for free but you have to give a donation for villagers in 2 places when walking through terraces. Views are as beautiful and green as seen in the pictures. You will meet a lot of tourists here but place is so large that you will find a lot of moments alone for perfect pictures. Dont miss it!

Beautiful . Supposed to be the prettiest in whole bali. So I drove up there with the bycicle, good workout! It's going steady up.Beautiful area, even more pretty when the rice is almost fully grown up. With nice weather it's a good spot to watch the sunset. Also nice walking there around.
One of beautiful rice terrace in Bali. One of beautiful rice terrace in Bali. Nice atmosphere, lil bit tiring trek, but I got beautiful scenery on the top of rice terrace!
Great view. It was a very nice tour and the view was fantastic. Having a trip to the rice terrace is a must in Ubud.

A pretty sight!. Just taking a scooter around Ubud and going to the little Villages is part of the Bali experience if you ask me and this is just one of the many stops you should go to on your own tour!
It's Just an hour. This is a quick and easy stop by coming back from a mountain trek. Really beautiful, super inexpensive, and very unique.
The most beautiful rice terraces in BALI. My favorite rice terrasses in BALI, this place is amazingly beautiful and the walk to go through the rice terrasses is not easy but very nice.

Wonderful scenario. Really impressed by these rice fields. They are really huge and wonderful. Built with high technology to be irrigated. There are many rice fids in the area but these ones are probably the best. The transmit you peace

Not Impressive !. We went in August 2015 . Nothing much to see. Overly rated place ! Our very own Camerons tea plantations is very much nicer all year round. Dont think it's worth all the time and traffic jams to go there.There are other nicer places in Bali especially Ubud . I dont think I'll return to this place.

A Brief Trip to Ubud - Bali. This is a must visit location and you will be able to take lots of photographs. It was made famous by Julia Roberts in the film Eat, Pray & Love. Don't be pressurised into making a 'donation' to the lady who says it is for the foot bridge repairs, or if you are inclined make sure you have small change.
A site you have to see to believe.... Really enjoyed this picturesque view. You can walk down as far as you like (wear sensible shoes.) So magical, really enjoyed this...
Must see in Ubdu. Must see in Ubud, only a short ride away. Can get a bit crowded in the afternoon thus try to arrive early.

Amazing rice terraces in bali. There is no one in Bali,it is the the best and absolutely the people seek,we like very much the view And natural terraces ,we can't forget it so fast and will stay along in our mind as well,will see it on the next vacation to bali with the big group,enjoying a cup of coffee and tea then see the amazing view on the front,absolutely very exiting view in Bali

Local Life. Another excellent day out. Interesting to see the local people and how they live. Locals very friendly and like to show you around the Rice Terrace ...for a fee, however this is not much and worth doing.

Great photo opportunities. This was beautiful, but we had seen many sawas. It has a nice panoramic view and you can get refreshments there as well. Lots of good photo opportunities especially of the workers in the recefields.
Beautiful place. Great view of the tradittional rice terraces. You can have a walk through them or have the traditional bali or kopi luwak coffee while enjoying the view.

Beautiful Rice Terrace. Beautiful place. We could walk between the rice terrace and enjoy the green view.However, there will be someone asking for donation in the middle and you could not really say no as she was standing on your way. They were not fussy about the amount though, fortunately.

Unpleasant experience!. Bad experience as despite buying our ticket to Tegalalang Rice Terrace we were stop halfway and forced to donate 50$ or more for charity. It was not clear if the funds were being collected for charity or other reasons. The person was stoping every visitor. He was aggressive and rude.

july they are not so nice. Wrong time of the year, the rice fields were bare so we stayed a very short time and the kids didn't realy see what we were used to see when they are green and beautiful to look at. We will sacrifice ourselves and go back to Bali with them another time of the year to see it again...

Pure Nature!!!. The view of this area was great from all sides and there were a lot of tourists around. The different shades of the green were amazing to watch. It is a great place to shoot many nice pictures.

Very pretty, but demanding hawkers. Excellent and unique sight but walking through the paddy terraces there are gates where the locals demand "a donation" for the visit. They can be pretty ferocious at times but you can see the same (or better) view from the top. Also not for the faint hearted if you want to walk to the bottom and then up again- pretty steep and good cardio workout!

Nice rice terraces. Bit overrated and too many tourists.....could recommend doing a proper rice terrace walk with New Bali.....smaller private groups and you get a real experience of hiking for about an hour,lovely views with no one else in sight except your group - it's worth the money!

What a view!. Amazing view to be seen here. Would be better without the locals always haggling and pushing you to buy their things. Even the farmer asks you to give money to take a picture with him. Kills a bit the moment. But overall,the view is great,just nice to have a hot tea overlooking the view and go off.
Unique sight of Rice farming on terraces. The rice terraces of Tegalagang are special, while there are many rice paddy fields on terraces, this one looks quite stunning
Amazing place absolutely breathtaking.. Absolutely beautiful a must see for anyone going to Bali.The work that has gone into these terraces is amazing.Very busy lots of tourists.
super. there is no reason why not to go and check this out.stunning view,it was just beautiful!!!!would do it again if i get the chance

Despite the tourists, it's a must-see. It's not a tourist trap, restaurants offer fair prices for good food, shops are reasonable as well. The view is fantastic. I recommend getting a table at a restaurant with a good view.

A MUST see!. This place is beautiful, looking out at the rice terrace will leave you speechless. If you think this place looks breath taking in pictures wait until you see it for your own eyes. Will return next time I come back to Bali!

One of the must see / must go / must do things if you are in Bali. A very scenic place.. that takes a bit of drive to get to from Ubud. but the view is worth the trip. Be prepared to take a few climbs up and down the terrace to get closer to the terraces for nicer shots. Wear shoes as it could get muddy if you miss a step

Incredible. The views of the rice terraces are stunning and give a good indication of the harsh life the local people have had and are living.
Stretching all the way down a steep valley, this is the best living history you will see.
Great view towards sunset!. There is noo reason to not get a motorbike and check this out if your in Ubud! Not to hard to walk around and get great look at the surroundings.
Love the nature!. It is so amazing to see the rice terrace there. It looks very natural. We wish we could make it with the local people. It must be an unforgettable experience.

Visit view point of Ubud rice plantation terrace. The vast area of the rice feild plantation on the hills. We catched the taxi from Ubud to the location which took 30 min from Ubud town. When reach to the view point, we can take the picture on the road side or can walk down to the rice feild. However, check for the season when the rice goes green. We visitted in August , the rice just small grown.
Absolutely amazing and serene. Loved everthing about it beautiful breathtaking scenery. Never seen anything like it. Would have loved to walk in the rice fields maybe next time
Scenic view of the terraced rice paddies. Scenic view of the terraced rice paddies. Very popular stop in the day tours around Ubud so expect a lot of people.

beautiful views. it is so beautiful the rice had just been harvested but still so amazing we got photos carrying basket.stunning views so much hard work by Bali men and women.wear sneakers as the track rough but well worth it..
amazing. It is such a beautiful "must go"place in Ubud. Not really far from Monkey Forest which our hotel is located in. With a very green field there.

Will visit again next time.. Not sure if it's just us, but everytime when we visit the Tegalalang Rice Terrace, the fields are always in shades of browns. Hope to see the beautiful glorious greens one day! I'm sure it'll be worth the trip! (:

Must see traditional landscape and countryside. The Rice Terraces are a must see. Amazing country side and to see traditional rice crops being sown and grown was an experience. Walk around the terraces, stop and find a quite restaurant with views to eat at and take in the scenery.

amazing views. One of the best places to visit in Bali, views are stunning and breath taking. Take some time to walk across the fields and take many photos, they will look amazing during the daylight. Definitely worth visiting it, you shall include it in a tour to Kintamani volcano and Ubud or even stay 1-2 nights in Ubud to enjoy the views and tranquility of the place

Picturesque . It is so beautiful to see rice terrace, plus the pictures which come out of it are so nice. Besides picturesque view, nothing special about Tegalalang. Go there if you are looking for taking photo, but that's it.
Beautiful to see. It's a gorgeous place to see even if it is a tourist trap, watch out for the old lady with the baskets of grass, she'll hand them over to you before you know it you paid Rp10k pp.

Best rice field near by ubud. Tegallalang rice is very good pleace for visiting.because in this pleace you can to see beautiful rice field.if you like do takking that good area for fun.and than you can to see farmer activity in the rice field.take picture with them,help them to work there..soo fun

Not as amazing as expected but worth a look. We were just stopping by on our way to Besakih. Unfortunately the rice was just harvested and also it was around noon so the conditions were not optimal. I recommend maybe to go around sunset to get better lights for photos. Seemed a nice place for a hike, but I guess there are better places for that nearby or in the Northern areas of the island. In Ubud I preferred Campuhan Ridge Walk. Anyway, if you are in the area you should take a look at Tegalalang, as well!
Picturesque . I rember seeing a picture of these terraces at school and now I am amazed at the near super human effort put in by the people of Bali in the construction of them. Well worth the visit.

Not that beautiful if you come in the wrong time. Went there around the end of July. Some part of the place was green and some brown. Rice was not fully grown. However, the place still looked interesting.
Beautiful. I have been to this place many times with different friends. I've seen it at its most beautiful and stunning views. But between seasons not as stunning. But to me it was great to see.

Spend the day there!. We didn't realise we could spend the day there when we went. We just thought we would drive through and take a picture, but it is so much more. There is a strip of cosy little restaurants and cafes stepped on the opposite side of the valley, giving you a perfect view of the terraces. We had an absolutely perfect - and very cheap lunch. It was probably the best value for money out of any of the meals we had. The view is superb. You can take your time and walk through all the terraces, like walking through a park. We saw many people doing it whilst having our lunch, but we didn't have time to do it ourselves sadly - next time!

Pretty Place. Had a good time exploring the rice terrace. A lot of climbing to do but well worth the visit.Be careful as you climb up as I moved a little too fast and slipped into a huge puddle of water.What I didn't like about the place was the huts placed at strategic locations searching for donations.

Magnificent View & Great Tracking. It fantastic view and greeat for tracking between the rice field. At the restaurant could try Kopi Luwak and Durian (Durian depend on the season). If you stay in Denpasar or Kuta, better to plan your trip so you could visit as many places as possible. Near by location as Elephant Safari Park and Monkey Forest and on the way to Tampak Siring Presidential Palace also Tirta Empul Temple.

Great time trough the rise filelds. Just take a bike or a walk, from Ubud, and cross the rise fields to reach this great experience for your eyes and soul. The terraces are the best of the Ubud area and you shouldnt miss it!
tracking trail. everyone who enjoy tracking either trail must visit this area and walking among many trail route in near paddy field

Not so Amazing anymore. The rice terrace was cultivated many years ago.It had become too commercialised and notice a few redundant plots of padi fields.When tourist storm the areas, the farmers would prefer to earn from tourism. I believe the younger generations no longer wants to plough the fields.Landscape is beautiful. But, filled with too many tourist venturing into the landscape.Not photographic.

Stunning view. These terraces are outside of Ubud on the way to Tirta Empul. It is worth stopping to enjoy the sight and take a short hike through the rice terraces. Quite a steep climb in certain places but worth it.

Disappointed we were between planting seasons. This site is fine to see the terracing of rice patties and how they are intricately irrigated. Unfortunately we came at a time between plantings and there wasn't as much to see.
Beautiful view. Its a nice view, we had our lunch having this view, you feel very calm and nice. Its a good walk on ridges. lots of ups and downs.
beautiful. beautiful view, nice short trekking, fresh air. recommended. If you come here I suggest to really do the trekking, not just taking pictures from the cafes.

Nice view, but too many tourists. NIce place, but WAAAAY too touristy for us.
The road is lined with little shops all selling more or less the same stuff...
An amazing picture of something unique.. Very nice attraction, close to the town. You can hire a half day taxi to go there. There are a lot of cafes and shops near the place.

rice terraces. beautiful terraces, worth the trip, however, my favourite are the rice fields in Ubud. In Ubud onces you can see people working, and you can have a lovely walk among the rice field with a stop for coconut drink
Worth a trip. Not a clear route/path around the Terrace. Always being hassled by children selling post cards. But worth a visit
best for visiting,and tourist place. good place nice rice terrace,but no bigges rice field,this place is famous on the word,i think all the people know this place

Must see. Great views, only not in the right time of the year.. If you want to see the green rice fields go in September, the fields will be green. Eventhough it is a amazing place and definitly go al the way down and climb up the rice fields

Not many to see. I can find more beautiful ricefield around Ubud area other than this.
Too many tourists walk in the rice fields and please be careful with local people force us to give donation.
If you walk from Ubud to karangasem area but use small road, you will pass a lot of beautiful ricefield and of course more quiet.

to crowded and aggressive shop seller. i went to this place to my friend , the view was nice but to touristy beware dont buy anything from the shop they ready to rip you off and their price is CRAZY .we bought the table cloth they offer 450 thousand and we got 100 thousand in sukawati art market so if you want to buy souvenir or any other stuff dont buy in this place they are rude and crazy mostly the shop on top of terrace padi cafe

Postcard material. Beautiful place, the scenery in the mountains are breath-taking. Our driver went slow so we could take photos, usually have to pay as soon as you stop. A lot of hawkers who are very persistant. The rice terraces are quite unique, definitely worth a visit. Get out of the city and see the countryside.
Hard work. Very interesting to see how rice is grown and how much hard work is involved. Dont think I could do it.

Must do in Ubud. Great day out. My wife and I did this as part of a tour provided by our host in Ubud. We sat here at the end of a long day and had late lunch enjoying the view. Relaxing vibe in the Terrace Padi Cafe. This place is a must.

Lovely Terraces..... We got one of the best views by stopping a few meters before the crowded part of Tegalalang to see the rice terraces. The views are stunning and its incredible to see how the harvest them. A natural wonder, its an interesting place to visit, specially on the way back from the Kintamani Volcano....

Fantastic spot to explore and have lunch. Situated about 20 minutes north of Ubud. The rice terraces offer a worthwhile experience as long as you are prepared to trek a little. Equally you can easily view from the road, but walking through the rice terraces creates the appetite for lunch at the cafes that overlook the terraces from the roadside. There are also plenty of shops for all kinds of souvenirs and the approach road up the terraces has plenty of artisan stores where you can shop for a bargain piece of artwork etc.
A must to see. Amazing to see and well worth the effort to climb through the terraces. The local workers jus keep on with what they are doing, they work so hard.

Nicest rice terrasses but overcrowded. If you sit in one of the nice coffee shops below the main street and arrive an hour or two before noon you profit best from the spectacular view before the busses with tons of tourists arrive from Denpasar and overflood Tourist magnet.

AMAZING. it was the beginning of the season and the view and colours were amazing.nice walk from the bars to the other sides. there is a small donation for the farmers.the lengths fo the trek is around 1h. but it's woth the visit. it is more attractive than Jutelawih

"Donations" have ruined the place. I could imagine the Terraces being full of green rice fields with locals harvesting the rice, but unfortunately it has turned into a major tourist scam. You pay 10,000 rupiah a person as a toll to the police to enter the area. This is reasonable. I understand the need of the locals and lets be honest 10000 rupiah is less than 1 US dollar, even the budget traveller can afford that. But then you walk down and someone asks you for a donation to help maintain the rice fields, though I dont think you can call it a donation if they dont let you pass with out paying. I was still okay with this, I donated 20000 rupiah and my friend 10000. But then we walk to the top and there is another man asking for donations, I said I already gave a donation and he blocked the path refusing to let me through. I turned back, it didnt look that amazing past him, but all the money asking really ruined the experience for me. There is lso the faxt that most of the rice paddies are just muddy ponds that it doesnt seem anyone is tending. Driving around Bali I saw plenty of more beautiful rice paddies and people.
Something to appreciatet. Beautiful quiet scenery! Something not seen at home! A must go to spot in Bali. Spend time watching the local people work in these fields!

Lovely views . Excellent visit to the Tegalalang Rice Terrace. The views are fantastic and we took this in on a day trip. We did not do the trek as it was too late in the day to be treking but the views alone were amazing and there is some nice little bars and Cafes with excellent views should you be thirsty or hungry.

beautiful view take small lots of small money. absolutely beautiful walk through the rice paddies.however.............take you dollar bills as everything here as a price. this is our second visit and it seems the farmers now expect and actually follow you asking money for photos.one guy said he would take us to a different area at no charge (after we had already paid out to several for pics happily) and when we went to leave he grabbed me and said 'hey money'.i absolutely do no mind giving cash to see such a beautiful place, however it can be quite off putting when you are hounded for cash.i think it would just be better to pay a set price to get in, or a set price for a guide like at some other attractions.

Gorgeous. This area was really very gorgeous. The only downside I would have is it is extremely touristy and it is hard to take a picture without tourists being featured. Definitely get a driver if you come here!
Such a great view!. Worth a trip!.. all the ricefiels at landscapebeddings. Recommend to walk through the ricefields or have a lunch with a view on the ricefields.

Beautiful area to visit. Stunning area and not far from Ubud. It does get very crowded so patience is a virtue! If you are feeling energetic you can walk along the rice terraces. I visited with a great driver, Wayan Naja who I always book when I'm in Ubud. Wayan is a very professional and informative driver and passionate about Bali. He also took us to a really beautiful cafe for lunch that was about 5 minutes drive from the tourist area and away from the crowds. Wayan's numbers are (+62) 081 999 967 686 / (+62) 812 3936 7929. Highly recommend!

Visual Treat. We reached the spot at the end of a hectic day of temple visiting. Decided not to walk amongst the terraces; instead enjoyed the near bird's eye view from a cafe (next to the Gang Nam Cafe)

Lovely but have been ruined by tourism. There seems to be parking police if you go with a driver/by car and you pay to park. We went by scooter which was best later in afternoon and wasnt too busy - nice to just grab a drink and look at the terraces. Can imagine absolutely beautiful before they covered up the view with shops and restaurants. Didnt seem worth the hassel going down so we just enjoyed the view from up top. Not sure if you weren't staying in ubud if worth a special trip.

Beatiful and touristic. These sawas are really beatifull. You dan walk into the Rice fields and see with your OWN eyes the rice growing principle. It is quote touristic but lost of pushy sales men, but really Nice.

Most photographed spot in Bali!. There is really not that much to do here other than maybe eat at a small warung or buy some over-priced sarongs from the aggressive street vendors but you should see it, its the most photographed spot in Bali for good reason.

Tourist trap it is but.... Tourist trap it is but it was my only chance to actually walk along the rice fields and observe farmers working close up. There are similar views everywhere you look on Bali but the cost of the village ticket was minor to walk the planned route through the area.

Amazing views of beautiful green rice terraces. Rice paddies like this are a must when visiting Ubud. You can walk through the paddies and take photos, and afterwards there is a nice little buffet restaurant to stop for lunch, take in the view and eat rice that was harvested 20 feet away. Worth the visit!

Tourist Trap, not much to see. If you have an extra day to kill near Ubod, you might as well get food/drinks over looking the terrace. In my opinion, you can see the same thing all over Bali, especially on bike tours, but in better condition. This place really didnt do much for us.

Unbelievably beautiful.. This is a must to see when traveling on Bali. Hard to describe how beautiful these rice terraces are. Worth paying a visit, be prepared for some uphill walking (but not hard at all) and bring som small cash for the farmers checkpoints to support them. Bring your camera and enjoy the view. :)
Rice terrace. Very nice place to have a juice or a meal and take amazing pictures of rice terraces. Close to Ubud centre and has some shops to look around.
Do not miss this. Stunning rice field views not to be missed. Have a drink or lunch in one of the many restaurants overlooking the rice fields.

Waste of time. Went here for lunch as part of a day trip with a guide.While the view was ok, and the very windy and bumpy paths to get up were interesting briefly, it really didn't do anything for us. There are much more interesting and beautiful places to see in Bali, even in this area. Lunch was as expected, but a bit more pricy than other places. Personally, I'd prefer to see other places.

The beauty is being destroyed by tourist walking the rice fields.. My first visit to the rice fields was in 1998 March and they were so lush and green it was beautiful, I've been at different stages with my visits but this one sadend me to see that tourist are now walking a treak down and around the rice terraces so if your there to get the scenery shot choose your time wisely ask the locals when it's best to visit. I guess I will still go back but never again in peak season I just can't.
Lush green!. Simply very beautiful place with all the green lush paddy! Come over during rainy seasons so you can see the green paddy all over the fields.

Amazing morning through the rice fields. My friend and I stayed at the Bening Bungalow in Ubud and cousins of the owner brought us with them on their motorbike to explore the rice fields and Luwak coffee for the day. Would recommend to go on your own or like we did instead of a tour.(less people) It was our best day in Ubud by far!!!!

Absolutely beautiful . So scenic...plenty of trails to take so you make your own route. We walked around for an hour but you could easily do it all afternoon. At most bridges someone will ask for a small donation.

Nice place to see. Do not miss! Takes maybe 60 min and is worth of it. Is free, however they try to get a "Donations" on several "Checkpoints" like bridges. If you stay hard you can pass without paying.

Superb. Amazing place to go have food overlooking the terrace, trek over the rice terraces, or just sit on the top of the opposite street and gaze into nature.You'll need around 20 minutes by motorbike to reach there.very easy to locate and worth visiting
Amazing! Great experience and a must if you're in Ubud. Absolute must if you're in Ubud. Lots of areas to chill out. make sure u take some cash as there are beautiful art pieces to buy in the area!

Bad service, bad attitude, nice view, too crowded. I like the view, food taste is not bad, but when they brought wrong food, they are not happy to change it. and it forever for them to serve. I actually did not come for the food, just for the scenery they offer across their seating place.....a breathtaking paddy terrasering terrace. So I pardoned them...they are so lucky to have the location.

Nice to see. We didnt bother going in and climbing up and down, so we just stopped by and took some amazing photos. Place is occupied by people trying to sell you postcards and other stuff, so be ready:)Our driver told us to pay fee if someone comes up to us, but noone did.

Amazing views and experience. . We came here in the afternoon and it was fairly busy, but not too bad. The walk across consists of a valley which is quite tiring to walk, but worth it. The views from the other side are very good. There was a 'bridge' at the bottom which you had to cross over a small gorge, a man asks for money, but you don't need to pay him as he doesn't really do anything. Over all a great experience.

Has become a tourist haven,but still charming.. Tegalalang like many other places on this island has risen in notoriety to becoming a fotie shoot place, too many folk now getting in on the action. Admittedly this is a lovely spot, you climb out of your vehicle and look down across a valley of rice terraces as there are many on this wonderful island and they stretch for a vista full of photo opportunities. There are many terraces on the island and this one has become infamous so you will see hoards of bus loads of eager tourists all doing the same thing.It's still a scenic spot and will continue to be with itsvetdant greenery when the rice is growing and small sun shade huts along the terraces, its a good rest for your eyes.

Weird experience at the rice terrace. We went to Tegalalang by car. As soon as we exited from the car parking space on one side of the road, a person wearing a traffic police like fluorescent green vest approached us. He said that 10000 IDR per person was to be paid for entrance to the terrace and issued receipts. We paid up and walked in search of sign boards leading to the terrace. There weren't none. As we could see the terrace from the road, we finally just took a random entry point which had a flight of stairs leading down the small hill. We could see the rice terraces on the other side. Although we couldn't see the verdant green blanket of paddy fields as the paddies were just starting to grow, we were struck by the overall beauty of the terraces and the ingenious construction and irrigation method. We could see several tourists climbing on from the other side to the terrace. As we were climbing up, we were stopped rudely by a person who demanded that we pay a donation for visiting the terrace. When we mentioned that we had already bought the tickets, he became angry and started trying to block our way. When we said that we are going back and will see what can be done, he allowed us to pass but kept shouting at us and staring aggressively as we climbed up. Although the terraces were beautiful, we couldn't enjoy much because of this incident. There was another shed almost towards 3/4th of the terrace climb who was equally rude and said that we need to pay donation to climb higher. We said no thanks and climbed down. We tok some pictures after getting on the main road. Overall, it was an experience quite unlike how we were treated by the Balinese people so far. While it is possible that the people asking for donation are the actual farmers or owners of the place, the issue of donation is to be settled between them and the main ticket staff. Harassing tourists doesn't seem like the best way forward. Be careful to clarify this issue with the ticketing staff or your driver before visiting the terrace.

Beautiful surroundings worth a stop..great photo ops. Arrived at a time when most tourists were on to other things. A great photo stop, not much in the way of a tour, but the right driver or guide can give some quality insight. Take a few pictures and give out a few tips, everyone is happy. Not a lengthy stop.
Tegallalang rice terrace. One destination in bali you must visit this places. This place around 30 menit from ubud center. And what tha planted here is the white rice.
Beautiful scenery. Lovely place to visit. Sitting on the side of the Rice Paddys taking in the view whilst having a drink was great.

hyped up a bit but still worth an hour of your time. Very touristy, thr locals sit in their shaded lean to and expect a 'donation' fir using the paths and little bridges so bring plenty of dmall notes so as not to offend.The terraces are interesting and yes you can seize the photo opportunity.There are also seversl nice cafes to enjoy lunch snd admire the views. Worth a vist if you are staying close by.
Standard photo stop. This is a photo opportunity location that most tours will stop at during a Bali trip. It's quite beautiful to look at and photograph, but little else there to do.
Hyped Attraction . It's something which is very common in any Asian hill stations. It wasn't green as seen in the picture. Worth spending few minutes only if are really really bored!

traffic. nope, don't go here in the day, traffic jam will ruin your holiday, try to go in the morning or afternoon.
by the way the rice terrace is nice, it just not worth to go in the day and get stuck there.

'staggering paddy fields'. Natural staggering paddy fields.. but it's a harvesting period so wouldn't get the chance to see the all greenery..
Overall is worth!

It's a hike, but worth a visit. Pretty cool for photo opps, but be aware that to explore the entire terrace, you're better off bringing small bills for mandatory "donations" along the way. There are toll-men guarding the path. Not a big deal, but if you have big bills, good luck breaking them here.The path is a little tricky to navigate, so wear comfortable shoes and light clothing. It gets hot during the day.There also appears to be a parking fee if your tour guide parks along the road nearby. This may or may not have been legitimate.
Lovely view from road. Saw this on passing via a tour but although it mentioned it in the tour we weren't given the opportunity to stop and take photos
Good to see but thats it.. We went during dry season so it didnt quite looked as it does on the pictures. It was nice to see but no need to spend to much time there.
